snippet: A former prosecutor in Texas will spend 10 days in jail for withholding evidence in a murder trial — insultingly short, but a milestone.
abstract: Editorial welcomes fact that Texas prosecutor Ken Anderson will be jailed for failing to turn over exculpatory evidence in a murder trial that resulted in 25-year imprisonment for Michael Morton, even though 10-day sentence is insultingly short; calls for judges to issue standard written orders reminding prosecutors of their ethical duties.
lead_paragraph: A former prosecutor in Texas will spend 10 days in jail for withholding evidence in a murder trial — insultingly short, but a milestone.
